Posts.Content: Hi, Welcome to site ,I'm much the same, triple neg multi focal. 3 lumps biggest being 3cms. I had mastectomy. histology confirmed i had vascular and perineural invasion. I start FEC-T tomorrow, 6 cycles. I will keep posting how it goes. Positive thoughts Janice
Posts.Title: New here too and bracing myself for chemo

Posts.Content: After yesterdays meeting I was informed I had Invasive Lobular Cancer, grade 3 and would need a MRI to see whether the  cancer is in the other breast. I spent the evening reading up on ILC and emailed the Breast nurse to see if they had results on the hormone receptors. She emailed me this afternoon and wrote that they were negative  and HER-2 neg and ended the email with please give me a call. I called and she started the conversation by saying I am really very sorry ( my stomach flipped and I thought OMG) then she said " she had wrote down the wrong cancer on my information file I need to take to meeting.and infact I had Invasive Ductal cancer. I have accepted that everyone makes mistakes however my daughter is still ranting on about it.   Another interesting day on my journey battling cancer, let's see what tomorrow has to offer. LOL Janice
Posts.Title: Wrong cancer entered on my file

Posts.Content: Hi, I went to Marks today in Bluewater and they had some really lovely Mx bras and undies. I was really surprised!
Posts.Title: Help with finding matching MX underwear

Posts.Content: I did ask for the path report and the Breast Nurse said she would get a copy for me the next time I am in. I now know I have Invasive  Ductal Cancer, grade 3 and triple negative. I will see what the MRI shows up and go from there. I feel the Path report after histology is the report you need most, if you want to know the results, some don't. We all due with cancer in our own ways.
Posts.Title: Wrong cancer entered on my file

Posts.Content: Hi Lyndasten,  Since I posted this the breast nurse informed me that she had made a mistake and I have IDC grade 3, a triple neg. I am having a mx on the 26th March and should know treatment plan when I receive the histology. Mx is mastectomy, not sure what anc is. There are a few ladies on this site that are having their lumps shrink before having a mastectomy I am sure they will help you with information when they read your post. I find this site brilliant for support and just to air your feeling. Good luck when you have your scan. Janice
Posts.Title: Well didn't expect those results

Posts.Content: Went in for the meeting with consultant and team for results after biopsy expecting to be told when my date was for surgery. I was told I had Invasive Lobular cancer and would have to have an MRI to see whether or not there is any other cancer in both breasts. I am still calm and positive however it's the waiting time, MRI within 2 weeks and another 1 week before you are able to see consultant for results and I feel that I want it taken out to stop the spread of the cells through out my system as they were unable to tell me today whether or not it is contained within the breast. My cup is always half full, so positivity is the key Janice
Posts.Title: Well didn't expect those results

Posts.Content: Thanks Blue Tit, LOL and SaxxyD They think it hasn't spread to my nodes, I have three lumps the biggest being over 2cms and it's a grade 3. Not looking forward to lying face down when i have the MRI, get indigestion when I lie on my stomach. Oh well it's only 30 minutes. Thanks again Janice
Posts.Title: Well didn't expect those results

Posts.Content: Hi Tabitha, know what you mean the waiting for results is an anxious time. I was sitting in the car today listening to Simply Red and I started crying. My husband said " OMG I thought you liked Simply Red " LOL. I was diagnosis with IDC grade 3 triple neg on the 20/2. I thought at the last visit I would be told when I would have the mastectomy however he told me I would have to have an MRI to see if there's any cancer in other breast and that's  on Monday. I take comfort from what all the other ladies on this site say and the general feeling seems to be that it becomes easier when you have all the results and you know exactly what you are dealing with. So take care, cup half full. Janice
Posts.Title: on a proper downer :(

Posts.Content: Hiya, I went to Nicola Jane to be fitted for some bras and prosthesis and they are the most comfortable mastectomy bras ever. I forget that I am wearing a prosthesis. When I was wearing the awful comfy I kept checking that it was in place. lol. There is a web site  www.nicolajane.com Janice
Posts.Title: Flat chest?

Posts.Content: Hi Suzyjane, When we are faced with our own mortitly your thoughts are normal. I look at my grandchildren and sometimes get really sad thinking I may never see them grow into young adults however I try and put things into prespective no dr has told me I am not going to survive and I have decided I am going to enjoy life and see what tomorrow brings. I had a mastectomy 4 weeks ago and am due to start FEC-T in a couple of weeks. Is there a support group in your area you can join, so you have other women to talk to?.....Big hugs to you Janice
Posts.Title: Breast lump hardened and sore during fec chemo - is this normal?

Posts.Content: Hi, Does your daughter work for a hairdressers because they generally have a supplier whom they purchase their wigs from. My daughter is getting mine through her place of work. They purchase wigs from trendco, you can buy them online. They have some trendy styles for your daughter to look at. I believe there is also a shop in Thurrock that supplies real hair wigs. Hope all goes well and hugs to your daughter. Janice
Posts.Title: Real hair wig info required

Posts.Content: When I was told I had to have a mx, they consultant said I could go for day surgery or stay over night.  I went in yesterday 27th for the mx. The op was fine however the day ward was awlful and I felt they wanted me out by 5pm. I came out not able to focus because of dizzness and a high temperature and all I wanted to do was sleep could not wake up enough to get dressed. My husband had to dress me. The staff nurse said" I would be fine". and I do feel alot better today. I do realised not all day surgery wards are like this. If I had thought through the risks of such invasive surgery and how I may feel after the op I would have come to the conclusion I should have stayed in. Big Hugs to everyone Janice
Posts.Title: Had MX, wish I had stayed in over night

Posts.Content: Hi Isabella, The time between diagnosis and surgery and histology is a difficult time because we are dealing with the unknown. You haven't added what your diagnosis was, there is a section on the MacMillian site thats lists question you could ask. and it depends how much you want to know. I was disgnosed with IDC grade 3 triple neg breast cancer, had a mastectomy with no recon on the 26th March, on histology 10 days after mastectomy I was told it was at stage 2b and only i node had a small amount of cancer in it. I am now due to start FEC-T chemo. Since histology I haven't worried about at all, I know exactly what I am dealing with. This is a brilliant site and lots of lovely ladies who will help and support you Big hugs and lots of positive thoughts Janice
Posts.Title: New to the Group

Posts.Content: Thanks for the information that was helpful. The Macmillan nurse gave me her card last Monday so I do have a point of call if I need to speak to some one.  Good luck on Friday.
Posts.Title: Had biopsy, see consultant tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi Lindy1802 Thanks that was really helpful, will ask for copy of path lab report, I have been reading about stage and grades of cancer over the past few days. I feel it helps to have a general understanding of some of the things they may talk about tomorrow. My husband is coming with me hopefully he will listen and remember the information when we come to discuss it after the meeting. lol
Posts.Title: Had biopsy, see consultant tomorrow

Posts.Content: I was told last Monday that I had breast cancer, had a biopsy same day. During the biopsy she was very informative relating how big lump  was she didn't think it was in my lymph nodes. I feel very calm about meeting tomorrow and have been reading a lot on stages and grades of cancer. Is there any questions I should be asking the consultant that perhaps you wish you had asked but didn't think of at the time
Posts.Title: Had biopsy, see consultant tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi Kipper107, I am 57yrs old and have mobility problems with deformed feet. I have IDC grade 3, stage 2b, multi focal, with vascular invasion so I had a mastectomy on the 26/3 and am due to start FEC-T sometime in May. I live near to you and could meet you for coffee some where like Wisley. PM me if you want to...Janice xx
Posts.Title: All new and very scared
